intro: Psychotria pubituba, commonly known as the hairy psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are covered in fine, short hairs. It produces small, greenish-white flowers that are often clustered in inflorescences. Psychotria pubituba is typically found in humid, shaded environments such as rainforests and secondary growth areas.
